intro: Cephalomanes meifolium, commonly known as the meadow crownflower, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its showy, yellow-to-orange flower head, which blooms in late summer. Cephalomanes meifolium thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
